-- Shortcut handling
A = Add to DCRM:
Lines dont fit 1 close small, 2 reopen in large, 3 reopen small wo closing
if it all fits call without closing
if blob not empty overwrite else add 2 * CrLf (blank line)
if first row on empty blob overwrite with MQTX_TEXT
Then test, if new notice exists already:
Notice is present already? Yes => give message:
"Signal already saved":
"Signal not saved already?" / New notice: => give message, if it is realy saved:
Blob not empty:
User has agreed to add notice:
"Signal saved":
Blob IS empty:
if blob empty overwrite else add CrLf (blank line)
"Signal saved":
:End: Blob empty
:End: Notice saved already
Initialize has alpha-type Blob:
then initialize with DCRM_NOTICE:
if first row on empty blob overwrite with MQTX_TEXT
Init output parameter:
Initialize has alpha-type Blob:
Create first standard line:
if first row on empty blob overwrite with MQTX_TEXT
Checks, if the new notice exists already.
Is the new notice already in the DB?
